item.title: Silence - a fable
item.description: “Listen to me,” said the Demon, as he placed his hand upon my head. “There is a spot upon this accursed earth which thou hast never yet beheld And if by any chance thou hast beheld it, it must have been in one of those vigorous dreams which come like the Simoon upon the brain of the sleeper who hath lain down to sleep among the forbidden sunbeams –among the sunbeams, I say, which slide from off the solemn columns of the melancholy temples in the wilderness.
